intro: Heterocodon, commonly known as the rock bellflower, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Campanulaceae. It consists of several species, most of which are native to regions of Europe, North Africa, and Western Asia. The plants typically have basal leaves and produce showy, bell-shaped flowers in shades of blue, violet, or white. They are often found growing in rocky or sandy soils, thriving in sunny to partially shaded environments. The genus is characterized by its distinctive floral structure and adaptability to various ecological conditions.
